getWalkInConsentFormQuestions.message: List of consent form questions fetched successfully.

disclaimerData.disclaimer:
Procedure Overview
CO2 (Carbon Dioxide) laser resurfacing is a skin renewal technique that employs laser technology to precisely eliminate skin layers, encouraging collagen formation and resulting in smoother, firmer, and more uniformly toned skin. It is frequently utilized to address wrinkles, acne scars, sun damage, and various skin irregularities.

Expected Benefits
Enhanced skin texture and tone

Diminished fine lines, wrinkles, and acne scarring

Skin firmness and revitalization

Balanced pigmentation and reduced sun-related damage

Risks and Potential Side Effects
Although most clients achieve favorable outcomes, possible risks and side effects may include:

Post-treatment redness, swelling, and discomfort

Skin darkening (hyperpigmentation) or lightening (hypopigmentation)

Scarring or infection risk

Extended healing duration or heightened sensitivity

Reactivation of herpes simplex virus (in predisposed individuals)

Milia formation or minor white bumps during recovery

Irregular skin texture

Unsatisfactory aesthetic outcome

These risks will be thoroughly discussed before treatment, with precautions implemented to reduce their likelihood.

Contraindications
You must disclose to the practitioner if you have experienced or currently have any of the following:

Active skin infection or inflammation in the treatment area

History of keloid or excessive scarring

Recent isotretinoin (Accutane) use

Pregnancy or breastfeeding status

Immune system deficiencies

Tendency toward impaired wound healing

Pre-Treatment Guidelines
Avoid sun exposure and apply SPF 50+ sunscreen for at least 2 weeks prior

Cease use of retinoids or exfoliants 5–7 days before treatment

Ensure any cold sores have completely resolved

Adhere to all skincare and medication instructions provided by your practitioner

Post-Treatment Care Instructions
Apply prescribed healing ointments and moisturizers

Do not pick, scratch, or peel treated skin

Avoid sun exposure and consistently use high-SPF sunscreen

Elevate your head while sleeping to minimize swelling

Refrain from vigorous activities and saunas for 7–10 days

Attend all scheduled follow-up appointments for progress evaluation

Complete skin recovery may require 7–14 days or longer, depending on treatment depth

Informed Consent and Documentation
I confirm that I have been informed about all relevant aspects of this treatment and fully understand this information. This includes comprehensive details regarding:

treatment objectives and desired results
inherent procedural risks
risks associated with declining treatment
personalized risks specific to my health profile
expected treatment benefits
potential limitations or disadvantages
alternative treatment options and their advantages/disadvantages - including the choice of no intervention
uncertainties and probability of successful outcomes
any necessary follow-up treatments

Clinical Photography: I authorize the capture of clinical photographs and videos. I understand these records will become part of my confidential medical documentation.

I have been consulted regarding information necessary for informed decision-making and have had adequate opportunity to discuss my treatment goals comprehensively.

I certify that I have read and completely comprehend this consent information. I have been provided sufficient time for discussion, and all my inquiries have been satisfactorily addressed. No new information has emerged that alters my decision to proceed with treatment or provide consent. I hereby authorize this procedure. This document represents complete disclosure and supersedes all previous verbal or written communications.

All deposits and booking fees are non-refundable unless mutually agreed upon with the practitioner.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the information that has been presented to you?
Do you believe adequate information has been provided for you to give informed consent?
Has your consent been provided voluntarily and without pressure?
Are you currently managing any health conditions?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing?
Do you have any neuromuscular disorders (such as MS, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Have you been diagnosed with an autoimmune condition?
Do you have any existing skin concerns or conditions?
Do you have any known allergies or history of severe allergic reactions?
Is there any active infection present in the intended treatment area?
Are you currently using any prescribed medications, including antibiotics?
Is there any other medical or social history we should be aware of? Please provide complete details.
What are your primary goals and expected outcomes for this procedure? Please describe thoroughly.
Have you previously undergone similar treatments? If yes, did you experience any issues? Please provide complete details.
Do you have any specific concerns about the treatment? If yes, please describe thoroughly.
Is there any additional information we should know? Please provide complete details.
I will maintain access to this information throughout my treatment and reference it as needed.
